messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
I can help with that—could you please provide the latitude and longitude coordinates of your current location? Once I have those, I can look up the corresponding address or place name for you.

To look up your location for you, I’ll need some way to pinpoint where you are. If you’re on a device or app that can share your location, please enable location sharing or give me your latitude and longitude.

If you can’t get coordinates, you could tell me:
• City and country  
• ZIP/postal code  
• Any nearby landmark or address  

With any of those details, I can help identify exactly where you are.
I don't have any of those details either.

I’m afraid I can’t determine your location without any geographic reference. Here are a few easy ways you can grab at least a latitude/longitude pair (or an address) to share:

1. From a smartphone  
   - iPhone:  
     • Open Apple Maps or Google Maps  
     • Tap the location arrow (or the blue “current location” dot)  
     • Press and hold on your blue dot until a pin drops—swipe up on the pin card to see the coordinates  
   - Android:  
     • Open Google Maps  
     • Tap the “current location” dot  
     • Your latitude/longitude appear in the search bar at the top  

2. From a web browser on a laptop/desktop  
   - Go to maps.google.com  
   - Click the “locate me” button (target icon) in the bottom-right corner  
   - Right-click on the blue dot that marks you, then choose “What’s here?” — the coordinates show up in the search box  

3. Using your device’s built-in GPS settings (if available)  
   - On many phones you can open Settings → Location → Location services → Systems → Tap “Location sharing” or “Manage location accuracy” and often see your current coordinates.

Once you’ve copied the latitude and longitude (or a street address), send them over and I’ll pinpoint exactly where you are.
Could you try checking again or maybe find another way to see your location?

I’m still unable to determine your location without some form of geographic input—whether that’s coordinates, an address, a city name, a ZIP code, or even a nearby landmark. 

Unfortunately I don’t have any built-in visibility into your device’s GPS or IP address. If you can’t share coordinates or an address, here are a couple more ideas:

  • Enable location sharing in your browser or app and then paste the coordinates it gives you.  
  • Use a free web service like “whatismyipaddress.com” to get an approximate location from your IP (keep in mind this is often only accurate to the city level).  
  • Ask someone nearby for the street address or city you’re in.

Once you have any of those details, I can look up your exact location. Let me know if you can try one of these!
